comment.author: 68259076@N06
comment._content: Back in NYC when I was a child, 1940-1950's, the kids went around with homemade costumes and face paint and knocked on people's doors, just like on Halloween, and we'd say, "Anything for Thanksgiving?"  I don't know when the practice started, maybe during the Depression.  By the time the 1960's came around, no one did it anymore.  Those are good memories!
